name: Alchemist's Boots
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Badger Boots
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Boots of Haste
notes:
Notes
When worn, the Boots of Haste (BOH) increase movement by 20 speed points. To understand the increase, consider that a level 20 character wearing BOH, would now move as fast as a level 40 character (base speed). Check Speed Breakpoints to know when is worth to equip and use them.
 See also: SpeedÂ and Speed Breakpoints  
They can be traded for an Enchanted Chicken Wing at Haroun or Yaman. They are a reward from The Queen of the Banshees Quest. They are required for the Troll Sabotage Quest.

name: Boots of Homecoming (Used)
notes:
Notes
Used Boots of Homecoming. You will have to wait 24(?) hours to use them again.

name: Boots of Homecoming
notes:
Notes
When used inside of a protection zone, they will teleport you in front of the Ferumbras Citadel found here and the text will appear:
Magical sparks whirl around the boots and suddenly you are somewhere else.
If you do not meet the criteria to be able to teleport using these boots, the message below will appear, accompanied by two graphical effects: red sparkles overlaid with an explosion effect, both displayed ontop your character.
Some magical sparks blaze up and die out immediately. There is an energy barrier somewhere that you cannot pass yet.
 
These boots have a 24-hour cooldown period and lack a visible indication of their charge status. The easiest method to confirm their readiness for teleportation (when not on cooldown) is to maintain them in a 'charged' state on your action bar. Alternatively, if not pre-set on an action bar, you can ascertain their charge by placing them in your depot and checking The Market, as only boots that are charged can be sold on the market.

name: Boots of Waterwalking
notes:
Notes
It looks the same as Soft Boots. Its data can be seen on the Market.According to Tibian manual, you can't walk on water fields. This suggests these boots are not meant to be obtained.
They can be seen beneath the Serpentine Tower in Ankrahmun below the room with a Fire Elemental, a Vampire and a Behemoth. Be careful as the Fire Elemental below ground floor or the Green Djinn on the bottom floor can be let out. See a screenshot here.
They can also be seen under a fence in Morguthis Room.

name: Broken Iks Sandals
notes:
Notes
This item is one of the four required to obtain the first addon for the Ancient Aucar Outfits.

name: Bunnyslippers
notes:
Notes
It's a very rare drop from a very rare creature. They are extremely rare boots that have only been confirmed to exist on a few game worlds. Since Winter Update 2010, Bunnyslippers also are a rare gift from Santa Claus, thus reducing their rarity and value a bit.

name: Cobra Boots
notes:
Notes
They are the second best knight boots in the game due to their 6% physical resistance, only topped by the Pair of Soulwalkers.

name: Coconut Shoes
notes:
Notes
Elegant shoes made of coconut, they are reasonably rare and a fine decoration. For many people these shoes are valuable. It was first seen on June 1, 2009.  See also: Dryad Set

name: Crocodile Boots
notes:
Notes
Crocodile Boots are identical to Leather Boots in both armor rating and weight, but have been traded at seemingly ridiculous prices due to their rarity and the fact that free accounts are unable to loot them for themselves. Their graphic is a recolored version of the old sprite of Leather Boots.

name: Crystal Boots
notes:
Notes
It's a very rare item.

name: Depth Calcei
notes:
Notes
Part of the Depth Set.

name: Dragon Scale Boots
notes:
Notes
It's a very rare item. Part of the Dragon Set.

name: Draken Boots
notes:
Notes
An excellent choice for people searching for a balance between armor and speed.

name: Feverbloom Boots
notes:
Notes
It's part of the Naga Set.

name: Filthy Bunnyslippers
notes:
Notes
You can dig filthy bunnyslippers at Vigintia's treasure hunting zone.It was introduced to celebrate Tibia's 20th Anniversary.

name: Firewalker Boots
notes:
Notes
These boots reduce the direct damage from walking on Fire Fields by 90% and they also reduce the number of times you burn afterwards (2 instead of 7). They have energy for 60 minutes and can be recharged with an enchanted ruby.
Obtained in a mission of The Hidden City of Beregar Quest.

name: Fish Tail (Equipped)
notes:
Notes
This is the equipped version of Fish Tail (Unequipped). Similarly to Depth Galea and Helmet of the Deep, the equipped Fish Tail might only exist when the character wearing it is underwater. This is believed to be an Unobtainable Item.

name: Fish Tail (Unequipped)
notes:
Notes
When you equip this item, it will become a Fish Tail (Equipped) which gives a speed boost of +300. This is believed to be an Unobtainable Item.

name: Frostflower Boots
notes:
Notes
It's part of the Naga Set.

name: Fur Boots
notes:
Notes
In Summer Update 2008 these boots received a speed penalty of -6. There was an unknown decrease in speed before the update, see Discussion for more details.
They are a good replacement for Leather Boots, because they have a higher armor value and are only 3 oz. heavier, but it will make you walk slightly slower.

name: Glacier Shoes
notes:
Notes
They give 5% protection from Ice Damage, but increase damage taken from Energy by 5%. They are part of the Glacier Set.

name: Golden Boots
notes:
Notes
They are a part of the Golden Set. A pair of these can be seen at Darashia's Catacombs, near Koshei the Deathless's room, as well as in the Venore Amazon Camp treasure room.
The sprite of the Golden Boots was changed in the Winter Update of 2008. In addition to the change of the sprite, they were also re-introduced into the game. Nowadays they can be seen on various worlds.

name: Green Demon Slippers
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Guardian Boots
notes:
Notes
They used to be the best boots in the game due to their passive 2% physical resistance, before Depth Calcei was introduced.

name: Leather Boots
notes:
Notes
The most common boots. They can usually be found in great numbers on the floor of certain caves or inside weak monsters such as Trolls. In Rookgaard, they have some value to lower levels.

name: Lightning Boots
notes:
Notes
They give 5% protection from Energy Damage, but increase damage taken from Earth by 5%. They are part of the Lightning Set.

name: Magma Boots
notes:
Notes
They give 5% protection from Fire Damage, but increase damage taken from Ice by 5%. They are part of the Magma Set.

name: Make-Do Boots
notes:
Notes
Part of the Jungle Set.

name: Makeshift Boots
notes:
Notes
Part of the Jungle Set.

name: Metal Spats
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Mutant Bone Boots
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Oriental Shoes
notes:
Notes
Similar to the draken boots but lacking 1 point of armor, this is the best pair of footwear that combines armor and speed for sorcerers and druids.

name: Pair of Dreamwalkers
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Pair of Nightmare Boots
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Pair of Soft Boots
notes:
Notes
Obtained through the Pits of Inferno Quest. When the boots get completely used, they become a pair of Worn Soft Boots.
These boots increase your Mana and Hitpoints Regeneration for 240 minutes (4 hours) by the rate of 3 HP and 12 MP per 6 seconds (0.5 HP and 2 MP / s), which means they recover 28800 MP and 7200 HP in total (for all vocations). Very useful when hunting or making runes, specially in resting areas as health and mana gained are also doubled (6 HP and 24 mana every 6 seconds) if the reward streak is 6 or higher. As a higher level option for hunts, Void Boots have the same regeneration bonus with added armor and speed.
Results of four hours of regeneration with Soft Boots:




D/S
ED/MS
K
EK
P
RP


Health (Boots only)

7200


Mana (Boots only)

28800


Health (Food + Boots)

8400
9600

9000
9600


Mana (Food + Boots)

38400
43200
33600
36000
38400

When a promoted mage is using Soft Boots and regenerating Mana by eating Food at the same time, they can make 129 SDs, 171 Magic Walls, 324 GFBs or Avalanches, 470 Icicles, 108 UHs, or 1230 HMMs during the 4 hours that the boots last. This is profitable for Druids making Icicles, taking into consideration the boots' recharging cost. It can also profitable for Sorcerers to make SDs, depending on the SD price on the server. This provides a cost effective way of mana training. A promoted Paladin can make a total of 109 Enchanted Spears if they are eating while using Soft Boots. Knights also use these when they hunt weaker creatures, as they only need Spells to heal, or to reduce Mana Potion usage when hunting stronger creatures, such as dragons and dragon lords, or when blocking. When combined with life Ring or Ring of Healing, making runes or Enchanted Spears becomes even faster, allowing players to mana train more effectively and create a greater number of items.
A pair can be seen in Santa's House on Vega. Soft Boots look the same as Boots of Waterwalking.
See the GP/MP, GP/HP, Cap/MP and Cap/HP efficiency tables for more information.

name: Pair of Soulstalkers
notes:
Notes
Part of the Soul Set and the best Boots for Paladins in the game.
It is a possible reward of the Soul War Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Soul Set the first time said quest is completed.
This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Desire, which can be looted from any enemy or boss in the 5 areas of the Soul War Quest if some conditions are met.

name: Pair of Soulwalkers

attributes.Attributes: sword fighting +1, club fighting +1, axe fighting +1, speed +15

notes:
Notes
Part of the Soul Set and one of the best Boots for Knights in the game.
It is a possible reward of the Soul War Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Soul Set the first time said quest is completed.
This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Desire, which can be looted from any enemy or boss in the 5 areas of the Soul War Quest if some conditions are met.

name: Patched Boots
notes:
Notes
They can be seen in the Amazon Camp Treasure Room. The name, weight and armor came up when trading to the NPC Rashid and can be seen in the Market and Cyclopedia. It's still unknown how to obtain this item.

Patched Boots at Amazon Camp Treasure Room

name: Pirate Boots
notes:
Notes
A part of the Pirate Set. Price depends a bit on the price of Steel Boots. On older worlds, such as Hiberna, you can get a full Pirate Set (including boots) for around 15,000 gp nowadays. The boots are also slightly better than Fur Boots despite having the same armor, for not decreasing speed and being lighter.Looks the same as Worn-out Pirate Boots.
Needed for the Meriana Quest.

name: Prismatic Boots
notes:
Notes
Part of the Prismatic Set.

name: Sandals
notes:
Notes
The most worthless Boots of Tibia. People once said that you will be 5% faster, but this turned out to be a myth. Considered a rare on Rookgaard. You can find this on a quest chest at Sam's shop at Thais just on his bedroom. Can be found as a daily spawn in Dusalk's Troll Clan Cave.
Obtained from Goblin Temple Quest on Rookgaard.

name: Sanguine Boots

attributes.Augments: Avatar of Storm -> -900s cooldown, Hell's Core -> +8% critical extra damage, Energy Wave -> +8% critical extra damage
attributes.Attributes: speed +10, magic level +2, death magic level +1

notes:
Notes
It is part of the Sanguine Set. This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Covet, which can be looted from any boss in the 4 areas of the Rotten Blood Quest if some conditions are met. Can also be obtained through a Crimson Offering.

name: Sanguine Galoshes

attributes.Augments: Avatar of Nature -> -900s cooldown, Eternal Winter -> +8% critical extra damage, Terra Wave -> +8% critical extra damage
attributes.Attributes: speed +10, magic level +2, healing magic level +1

notes:
Notes
It is part of the Sanguine Set. This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Covet, which can be looted from any boss in the 4 areas of the Rotten Blood Quest if some conditions are met. Can also be obtained through a Crimson Offering.

name: Steel Boots
notes:
Notes
Expensive, but strong boots nonetheless. They are the fourth best boots in game and second best boots without level and vocation requirement. There were rumors saying that these boots decrease your speed, but these rumors are entirely false as proven by multiple tests.
Obtainable through the Demon Helmet Quest.

name: Stoic Iks Boots
notes:
Notes
Can not be imbued with Swiftness.

name: Stoic Iks Sandals

attributes.Augments: Great Energy Beam -> +5% critical extra damage, Great Death Beam -> +5% critical extra damage

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Terra Boots
notes:
Notes
These boots are becoming rare and in high demand due to the amount of mid-leveled mages hunting Earth Elementals. They give 5% protection from Earth Damage but increase damage taken from Fire by 5%. Part of the Terra Set.

name: Traditional Leather Shoes
notes:
Notes
Part of the Traditional Set.
Obtained by facing the Orger Treasure for the first time in your sixth edition of Orcsoberfest.

name: Treader of Torment
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Vampire Silk Slippers
notes:
Notes
Dropped by The Pale Count which makes it exceedingly rare since he doesn't spawn very often.

name: Void Boots
notes:
Notes
Look like  when used. Increases your Mana and Hitpoints Regeneration for 60 minutes (1 hour) by the rate of 3 HP and 12 MP per 6 seconds, for a total of 7200 MP and 1800 HP. Void Boots cannot be repaired and will disappear after use. As they have the same regeneration bonus as Soft Boots, the Void Boots are a better alternative while hunting due to armor and speed bonuses. If they cost less than 2500 gold on your game world, they are even cheaper than Soft Boots to use.

name: Winged Boots
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Yalahari Footwraps
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Yetislippers
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Zaoan Shoes
notes:
Notes
On one hand these boots can be used effectively by low level players because of their low price and a decent speed bonus and armor. On the other hand these boots aren't very useful, because some might consider their armor and speed bonus as too low. Part of the Zaoan Set.
